section.p: Before uninstalling a Metrics Agent from an OpenStack node, it is recommended that you make a backup of the configuration files created for operation. The configuration files for an agent are located in the /etc/monasca/agent directory.
does not offer integrated backup and recovery mechanisms. Use the standard file system mechanisms instead.
To uninstall a Metrics Agent, proceed as follows:

li.p: Log in to the OpenStack node on which the agent is installed.
Stop the monasca-agent service and delete all related files:
li.codeblock: systemctl stop monasca-agent systemctl disable monasca-agent sudo rm -f /etc/systemd/system/monasca-agent.service systemctl daemon-reload systemctl reset-failed monasca-agent

p.i: ##is sudo required for each command? see above in other sections##

li.p: Remove all directories and files created by the agent installer:
li.codeblock: sudo rm -rf <target_dir> sudo rm -rf /etc/monasca/agent/ sudo rm -f /etc/sudoers.d/mon-agent
li.p: Replace <target_dir> by the directory in which the agent is installed, (e.g. /opt/monasca-agent).

p.i: ##What about /opt/monasca-agent/share/monasca/agent/conf.d with the templates for additional metrics to be manually enabled

li.p: Remove the agent's log files and the log directory:
Remove the mon-agent user. Use -r to also remove the mon-agent user's home directory.
